content: As an AI language model, I do not have personal opinions. However, an associate professorship is a career path in academia, and research is a significant component of the job expectations. Research is often required for associate professorships because it demonstrates an understanding of the field and an ability to contribute to it. While teaching is also an important aspect of academia, it is not the only component considered during the promotion process. In practice, promotion committees and universities usually assess candidates' overall job performance, including research, teaching, mentoring, and other factors, rather than relying on a single criterion. However, teaching ability does matter, and universities are increasingly recognizing the importance of quality teaching by creating teaching-focused promotions and awards.
